objectives: Describe architecture, memory systems, and evolution of computers.
Convert between number systems and analyze binary arithmetic.
Implement control structures, arrays, pointers, and functions in C.
Demonstrate structured data types and file I/O.
outcomes: CO1: Describe architecture, memory hierarchy, and components.
CO2: Convert number systems and analyze IEEE754 representation.
CO3: Construct flowcharts and algorithms for problem solving.
CO4: Implement C programs using control structures, arrays, pointers.
CO5: Demonstrate structured data types and file handling.

modules.title: Module 1: Basics of Computing & Number Representation
modules.content: History and generations of computers. Classification: Digital, Analog, Hybrid, Micro, Mini, Mainframe. Architecture: I/O units, Memory (Primary & Secondary), CPU. Number systems: Binary, Octal, Decimal, Hexadecimal. Signed number representations (1's, 2's complement). Floating point: IEEE 754. ASCII codes. Compiler, interpreter, assembler.

modules.title: Module 2: Problem Solving & Introduction to C
modules.content: Algorithm, flowchart, pseudocode. Procedural vs Structured programming. C basics: keywords, identifiers, variable naming. Data types, constants, storage size, endianness. Operators: Arithmetic, Logical, Relational, Bitwise. I/O: scanf(), printf().

modules.title: Module 3: Control Structures & Program Design
modules.content: Control structures: if, if-else, switch, nested conditions. Loops: while, for, do-while, break, continue. goto and labels. Functions: declaration, definition, prototypes, Parameter passing, return types, recursion. Storage classes: auto, static, extern, register.

modules.title: Module 4: Arrays, Pointers and Strings
modules.content: Arrays: 1D & 2D, array to function passing. Pointers: basics, pointer arithmetic, pointer to arrays. Strings: character arrays, string library functions. Dynamic memory allocation: malloc(), calloc(), realloc(), free().

modules.title: Module 5: Structured Data Types & File Handling
modules.content: Structures: definition, initialization, array of structures. Unions, enum, typedef, bit fields. File I/O: fopen(), fclose(), fprintf(), fscanf(), fgetc(). Command line arguments.

text: Schaum's Outline of Programming with C by Byron S. Gottfried
Let Us C by Yashavant Kanetkar
refs: The C Programming Language by Brian W. Kernighan & Dennis M. Ritchie
Fundamentals of Computers by V. Rajaraman

objectives: Provide exposure to basic principles of physical sciences.
Develop insight into lasers, fibre optics, and holography.
Understand crystal structures and semiconductor physics.
Learn principles of quantum and statistical mechanics.
outcomes: CO1: Explain principles of lasers, fibre optics, and holography.
CO2: Identify crystal structures and distinguish between materials using band theory.
CO3: Utilize quantum theory principles (Schrödinger equation) to interpret phenomena.
CO4: Illustrate basic concepts of statistical mechanics.
CO5: Describe properties of nanomaterials and display/storage devices.

modules.title: Module 1: Modern Optics
modules.content: Laser: Einstein A/B coefficients, population inversion, Ruby laser, He-Ne laser, Semiconductor laser. Fibre Optics: Step index, Graded index, NA, Acceptance angle, losses. Holography: Theory and applications.

modules.title: Module 2: Solid State Physics
modules.content: Crystal Structure: Amorphous vs crystalline, Bravais lattice, Miller indices, packing factor, Bragg's equation. Semiconductors: Intrinsic/Extrinsic, p-n junction.

modules.title: Module 3: Quantum and Statistical Mechanics
modules.content: Quantum Theory: Black body radiation, Photoelectric/Compton Effect, Wave-particle duality, de Broglie hypothesis. Quantum Mechanics: Wave function, Uncertainty principle, Schrödinger equation. Statistical Mechanics: MB, BE, FD statistics, Fermi distribution.

modules.title: Module 4: Physics of Nanomaterials
modules.content: Quantum wells (2D), wires (1D), dots (0D). Quantum confinement. Carbon allotropes. Applications: CNT, graphene, electronic, medical.

modules.title: Module 5: Storage and Display Devices
modules.content: Magnetic storage materials. Operation of CRT, CRO, LED, and OLED.

text: Concepts of Modern Engineering Physics - A. S. Vasudeva
Introduction to Nanoscience and Nanotechnology - Charles P. Poole
refs: Solid state Physics - S. O. Pillai

objectives: Familiarize with matrix algebra and calculus techniques.
outcomes: CO2: Apply differential and integral calculus.

modules.title: Module 1: Linear Algebra
modules.content: Echelon form, Normal form. Inverse and rank. Consistency of linear equations. Eigenvalues and eigenvectors. Diagonalization, Cayley-Hamilton theorem.

modules.title: Module 2: Single Variable Calculus
modules.content: Rolle's Theorem, Mean value theorems, Taylor's and Maclaurin theorems with remainders; Taylor's series.

modules.title: Module 3: Multivariable Calculus (Diff)
modules.content: Limit, continuity, partial derivatives, Total derivative. Chain rules, Implicit functions. Euler's theorem (homogeneous). Jacobian. Maxima and minima (two variables).

modules.title: Module 4: Multivariable Calculus (Int)
modules.content: Double Integral, Triple Integral. Change of order. Line Integral, Surface Integral, Volume Integral. Change of variables.

modules.title: Module 1: Resources and Ecosystem
modules.content: Resources: Human resource, Population Growth (Exponential/Logistic), Max Sustainable Yield. Alternative Energy: Solar, tidal, geothermal, biomass. Ecosystem: Components, Food chain/web. Forest, Grassland, Desert, Pond ecosystems.

modules.title: Module 2: Environmental Degradation
modules.content: Air Pollution: Smog (Photochemical/London), Greenhouse effect, Global Warming, Acid rain, Ozone Depletion. Water Pollution: BOD, COD, Eutrophication, Heavy metals (As, Hg, Pb). Land Pollution: Solid wastes, Biomedical/E-wastes. Noise Pollution: dB levels, Threshold limits.

modules.title: Module 3: Environmental Management
modules.content: EIA, Environmental Auditing, Protection Acts, Carbon footprint, Green building (GRIHA). Pollution Control: Catalytic Converter, ESP. Water Treatment: Activated sludge, Permutit process. Waste Management: Land filling, incineration, composting.

modules.title: Module 4: Disaster Management
modules.content: Natural/Man-made disasters: earthquakes, floods, drought, cyclones, tsunami. Disaster Management cycle and policy.

text: Textbook of Environmental Studies - Erach Barucha
refs: A Text Book of Environmental Studies - Dr. D.K. Asthana

modules.title: Module 1: Overview of IKS
modules.content: Definition, Classification, Unique aspects. Vedic corpus: Vedas, Vedangas. Indian philosophical systems: Orthodox and Unorthodox schools.

modules.title: Module 2: Indian Numeral System & Astronomy
modules.content: Decimals, Zero, Unique approaches to numbers. Ancient Indian mathematicians. Historical development of astronomy.

modules.title: Module 3: Science & Technology Heritage
modules.content: Metals and metalworking. Mining and ore extraction. Structural engineering and architecture (planning, materials). Dyes, painting, Shipbuilding.

modules.title: Module 4: Traditional Knowledge Sectors
modules.content: Traditional Agriculture (resources, methods). Traditional Medicine and Surgery. History of traditional Art forms and Culture.

text: Traditional Knowledge System in India - Amit Jha
Introduction to Indian Knowledge System - B. Mahadevan
refs: The Wonder that was India - A.L. Basham

modules.title: Exp 1: Intro to C
modules.content: Basic Input/Output, Data Types, and Operators. Precedence and expressions.

modules.title: Exp 2: Conditionals
modules.content: if, if-else, nested if, switch-case constructs.

modules.title: Exp 3: Loops
modules.content: Iterative problem solving using for, while, do-while.

modules.title: Exp 4: Nested Loops
modules.content: Pattern Printing, Series Problems.

modules.title: Exp 5: Functions
modules.content: Call by value, return types, recursion.

modules.title: Exp 6-7: Arrays & Strings
modules.content: 1D/2D array manipulation. String functions, array of strings.

modules.title: Exp 8: Pointers
modules.content: Pointer arithmetic, pointers with arrays and functions.

modules.title: Exp 9: Dynamic Memory
modules.content: Allocation using malloc(), calloc(), free().

modules.title: Exp 10: Structures
modules.content: Defining, accessing, array of structures, pointer to structure.

modules.title: Exp 11: File I/O
modules.content: fopen, fprintf, fscanf, fgetc, fputc operations.

modules.title: Exp 12: Mini Project
modules.content: Combining structures, functions, and file I/O for a real-world scenario.

text: Schaum's Outline of Programming with C

objectives: Exposure to principles of physical sciences.

modules.title: Measurements & Errors (Mandatory)
modules.content: Error estimation using Slide callipers/ Screw-gauge/ travelling microscope.

modules.title: Classical Physics (Any 4)
modules.content: Torsional pendulum, Young's modulus, Rigidity modulus, Newton's ring, Laser diffraction, Optical Fibre NA & power loss.

modules.title: Quantum Physics (Any 2)
modules.content: Planck's constant (photoelectric cell), Frank-Hertz experiment, Stefan's Constant, Solar cell characteristics.

modules.title: Electronics/Semiconductor (Min 1)
modules.content: LCR Circuit Q-factor, I-V of LED/LDR, Band gap of semiconductor.

modules.title: Innovative Experiments
modules.content: e/m by Thomson method, Hall effect, Thermal conductivity, Polarimeter.

modules.title: Module 1: Intro to Engg Drawing
modules.content: Usage of Drawing instruments, Lettering. Conic sections (Rectangular Hyperbola). Cycloid, Epicycloid, Involute. Scales: Plain, Diagonal, Vernier.

modules.title: Module 2: Orthographic & Isometric
modules.content: Orthographic Projections: Points, lines, planes. Auxiliary Planes. Projection of Solids. Isometric Scale, Isometric Views of lines/planes/solids. Conversion to Orthographic.

modules.title: Module 3: Sections of Solids
modules.content: Sectional views (Prism, Cylinder, Pyramid, Cone). True shape. Development of surfaces. Sectional orthographic views of dwellings.

modules.title: Module 4: Overview of Comp Graphics
modules.content: CAD software demo: Menu, Toolbars, Drawing Area, Dialog boxes. Zooming, Select/Erase.

modules.title: Module 5: CAD Drawing
modules.content: Scale settings, Layers, Line types. Drawing straight lines, circles. Annotations. 2D blueprint form.

modules.title: Module 6: Design Project
modules.content: Simple team design project. 3D wire-frame and shaded solids using solid-modeling software.

outcomes: CO3: Adapt to global business environments.

modules.title: Module 1: Intro to Comm & Soft Skills
modules.content: Cyclic Process of Communication. Workplace Communication Principles. Non-Verbal communication. Soft Skills vs Hard Skills.

modules.title: Module 2: Active Listening
modules.content: Sub-skills (Predicting, Clarifying, Inferencing). Differences between Listening and Hearing. Barriers. Business Telephony.

modules.title: Module 3: Speaking Skills
modules.content: Public Speaking (Audience, Style, Voice). Pronunciation (Stress/Intonation). Fluency (JAM, Role Plays). Group Discussion (Do's and Don'ts).

modules.title: Module 4: Writing & Reading
modules.content: Book Review, Film Review. Reading Strategies (Note-taking, Summarizing). Verbal Aptitude (Synonyms, RC Passages).

modules.title: Module 5: Presentation Skills
modules.content: Structure: Preparation, Evidence, Delivery. Handling questions. Visual aids. Video Resume. Micro presentation.

text: A Handbook of Group Discussions - Pushp Lata
Telephoning in English - B. Jean Naterop

outcomes: CO2: Design linear structures (arrays, lists, stacks).

modules.title: Module 1: Introduction
modules.content: ADT, Data Types. Asymptotic notations: Big O, Theta, Omega. Time and space analysis.

modules.title: Module 2: Non-Restricted Linear Data Structure
modules.content: List ADT. Sequential vs Linked Representation. Arrays: Linearization, Polynomials, Sparse matrix. Linked List: Singly, Doubly, Circular.

modules.title: Module 3: Restricted Linear Data Structure
modules.content: Stack: Implementation, Infix to Postfix, Recursion (Tower of Hanoi). Queue: Linear, Circular, Dequeue.

modules.title: Module 4: Nonlinear Data structures
modules.content: Trees: Binary Trees, Traversals (Pre, In, Post). Threaded Binary Tree. BST. AVL Tree. B-Tree, B+ Tree. Heaps (Min/Max). Graphs: Adjacency matrix/list, DFS, BFS.

modules.title: Module 5: Sorting and Searching
modules.content: Sorting: Bubble, Insertion, Selection, Quick, Merge, Radix. Searching: Sequential, Binary, Interpolation. Hashing: Hash functions, Collision resolution.

text: Fundamentals of Data Structures of C - Ellis Horowitz
refs: Data Structures using C - Reema Thareja

modules.title: Module 1: Introduction to AI
modules.content: Definitions, Goals, History. Narrow vs General AI. Applications. AI for social good.

modules.title: Module 2: Intelligent Agents & Logic
modules.content: Agents and environments. Propositional Logic: Representation and Inference. Predicate Logic: Answer Extraction.

modules.title: Module 3: Overview of AI Branches
modules.content: Machine Learning, Deep Learning, NLP, Computer Vision, Expert Systems, Fuzzy Logic, Evolutionary algorithms, Planning.

modules.title: Module 4: Basics of Machine Learning
modules.content: Supervised vs Unsupervised. Datasets, features, labels. Decision trees (concept). ML pipeline.

modules.title: Module 5: Applications & Ethics
modules.content: Robotics, Industry 4.0. Ethics: Bias, Fairness, Privacy. Future scopes.

text: Beginner's Handbook for AI - Saptarsi Goswami

modules.title: Module 1: Number Systems & Boolean Algebra
modules.content: Binary, BCD, ASCII, Gray Codes. Boolean Laws. K-Map (up to 4 vars), Algebraic Simplification.

modules.title: Module 2: Combinational Circuits
modules.content: Half & Full Adder/Subtractor. Serial/Parallel Adders. MUX, DEMUX, Encoder, Decoder, Comparator, Code Converters.

modules.title: Module 3: Sequential Circuits
modules.content: Flip-Flops (SR, JK, D, T, Master-Slave). Counters (Ring, Johnson, Mod-N). Registers (SISO, SIPO, etc).

modules.title: Module 4: Data Rep & Arithmetic
modules.content: Integer Arithmetic, Booth's Algorithm. Addressing Modes. Instruction Formats.

modules.title: Module 5: CPU & Control Unit
modules.content: RTL, Bus Architecture. ALU Design. Hardwired vs Microprogrammed Control. Instruction Cycle.

modules.title: Module 6: Memory & I/O
modules.content: RAM, ROM. Memory Hierarchy: Cache (Mapping techniques), Virtual Memory (Paging). I/O Transfer: DMA, Interrupts.

text: Digital Logic and Computer Design - M. Morris Mano

modules.title: Module 1: Atomic Structure & Materials
modules.content: Schrodinger Wave Equation, Quantum Numbers, Slater's rule. Semiconductors (Si & Ge): Properties and role.

modules.title: Module 2: Thermodynamics & Electrochemistry
modules.content: Entropy, Gibbs Free Energy, Nernst Equation. Li-ion batteries: Working principle and applications.

modules.title: Module 3: Polymers & Industrial Chem
modules.content: Polymers: Bakelite, Nylon 6,6. Conducting polymers. Corrosion: Mechanisms, Control. Fuels: LPG, CNG, Calorific value.

modules.title: Module 4: Organic Reactions & Spectroscopy
modules.content: Nucleophilic/Electrophilic reactions. Drug synthesis (Paracetamol, Aspirin). UV-VIS (Lambert-Beer Law), IR Spectroscopy.

modules.title: Module 1: First Order ODE
modules.content: Exact ODE, Integrating factors. Linear ODE, Bernoulli's equation. Clairaut's equation.

modules.title: Module 2: Second Order ODE
modules.content: Constant coefficients: Complementary Function, Particular Integral. Variation of parameters. Cauchy-Euler.

modules.title: Module 3: Laplace Transform
modules.content: Definition, Shifting properties, Inverse LT, Convolution theorem. Solution of ODE using LT.

modules.title: Module 4: Numerical Methods
modules.content: Interpolation (Newton forward/backward, Lagrange). Integration (Trapezoidal, Simpson's 1/3). ODE Solution: Euler, Runge-Kutta.

modules.title: Module 1: Constitution
modules.content: Preamble, Fundamental Rights/Duties, Directive Principles. Parliament, President, Governor.

modules.title: Module 2: Ethical Thinking
modules.content: Work ethics, Values (Negative/Positive). Ethical values for Professional success.

modules.title: Module 3: Engineering Ethics
modules.content: Utilitarianism, Deontology. Codes of Ethics. Whistle blowing. Case studies: Bhopal Gas Tragedy, Chernobyl.

modules.title: Module 4: Business Ethics
modules.content: Ethical leadership. IPR, Plagiarism. Gender-based issues.

text: Introduction to Constitution of India - D.D. Basu

modules.title: Module 1: Basics
modules.content: Definition, History, Brainstorming. 2x2 Matrix, NABC method.

modules.title: Module 2: Process
modules.content: Empathize (5 Why), Define (Storytelling), Ideate (6-3-5), Prototype (MVP), Test (A/B testing).

modules.title: Module 3-5: Tools & Strategy
modules.content: Design Thinking in IT. Business Process modelling. Strategic innovations. Business Model.

modules.title: Module 6-7: Prob Solving & SDG
modules.content: TRIZ, SCAMPER, UI/UX. 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDG).

text: Karmin Design Thinking - Dr. Bala Ramadurai

modules.title: Exp 1-2: Arrays
modules.content: 1D/2D arrays manipulation. Polynomial representation using arrays.

modules.title: Exp 3-4: Linked Lists
modules.content: Singly Linked List (Insert, Delete). Doubly and Circular Linked Lists.

modules.title: Exp 5-6: Stacks
modules.content: Stack using array/list. Infix to Postfix conversion, Postfix evaluation.

modules.title: Exp 7: Queues
modules.content: Linear and Circular Queue. Queue using Linked List.

modules.title: Exp 8: Recursion
modules.content: Factorial, Fibonacci, Tower of Hanoi.

modules.title: Exp 9: Trees
modules.content: Binary Search Tree (Insertion, deletion, searching).

modules.title: Exp 10-11: Sorting
modules.content: Bubble, Insertion, Selection, Quick, Merge, Radix Sort.

modules.title: Exp 12: Searching
modules.content: Linear, Binary, Interpolation Search.

modules.title: Module 1: PROLOG Basics
modules.content: Understanding facts, rules, queries, and syntax.

modules.title: Module 2: Recursive definitions
modules.content: Fibonacci, Factorial, List length.

modules.title: Module 3-4: Knowledge Base
modules.content: Family relationships. Rules and inference.

modules.title: Module 5: List operations
modules.content: Membership, concatenation, reverse.

modules.title: Module 7: Expert System
modules.content: Mini project (e.g., Animal Classification, Medical diagnosis).

modules.title: Exp 1: Logic Gates
modules.content: Truth tables of Basic, Universal (NAND/NOR), XOR/XNOR gates.

modules.title: Exp 2: Boolean Simplification
modules.content: Design logic circuits from Boolean expressions (K-Maps).

modules.title: Exp 3: Adders/Subtractors
modules.content: Half/Full Adder, Half/Full Subtractor.

modules.title: Exp 4-6: MUX/DEMUX/Encoders
modules.content: Code Converters, Multiplexers, Decoders.

modules.title: Exp 7-9: Sequential Circuits
modules.content: Flip-Flops (SR, JK, D, T). Counters (Binary, Ring). Shift Registers.

modules.title: Exp 10-12: HDL
modules.content: Simulate arithmetic circuits using Verilog/VHDL. CPU Datapath.

modules.title: Titration
modules.content: Strength of NaOH (vs Oxalic acid). Fe2+ estimation (Permanganometry).

modules.title: Physical Properties
modules.content: Surface tension (Stalagmometer), Viscosity (Ostwald).

modules.title: Water Analysis
modules.content: Hardness (Complexometric), Chloride (Argentometric), Alkalinity, DO.

modules.title: Instrumental
modules.content: pH-metric titration. Conductometric titration.

modules.title: Synthesis
modules.content: Polymer (Bakelite), Silver Nanoparticles. Drug design.

modules.title: Electronics
modules.content: Schematic/PCB design (EagleCAD). Soldering. Sensors.

modules.title: Tools
modules.content: Hand tools, Power tools (Saws, Grinders). Welding.

modules.title: Machining & 3D Printing
modules.content: CNC routing, Laser cutting. 3D printing (FDM/SLA).

modules.title: Embedded Systems
modules.content: Arduino/Raspberry Pi programming. IoT.

modules.title: Project
modules.content: Mini project with enclosure and documentation.

subjects.name: Object Oriented Programming using Java Lab
Image Processing / Cloud / Big Data / NLP
